title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: " Ye ken, Kilgour," said Kennedy one day, " I wad stand bythe captain as long as another but for the yerl.

title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: " What men are these, think ye, Kilgour?" he speired.

title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: " Gude faith ! is that you, Kilgour, or your wraith ? "At the sound of the man's voice I kend him at once.

title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: "We'll hae grand times sune, Kilgour," said he, as he clatteredalongside, "grand times, and a walth o' fechtin'."

title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: " I've been thicker wi' that lass,Kilgour, thir aucht days, than a' the time I've kent her.

title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: So ye'll just have to make the best o't, Kilgour : and maybe it'sas weel ye should, for ye're no just in the best settle for a day inthe saddle, and—" he added, hesitating some-deal, " I wadnamind a day or sae langer mysel', to tell the truth, lad, for there'sa bit lassock here I've had an e'e on for a twalmonth or mairback—"

title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: "The matter is urgent," said he, "gif ye are agreeable to dothe laird's bidding, gude and weel, but gif ye are thrawn, and seton another course, I was to give you advertisement that youneed not look to him to serve your turn should you fall into badhands ; for albeit he bears you a gude will, Kilgour, lat me tellyou this—and no man besides his father kens better than I howthings be with Sir William—he is so hard beset himself, and soill at accord with the lords, that he is powerless to do more thanhe has commanded."

title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: " Hech me ! " said he, "ye arelike an auld done body, Kilgour," and for a bit he sat his horseand glowered down at me, as gif rowing some matter about in hismind whilk gave him little pleasure

title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: " I did it for the best, Kilgour," said he at length.

title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: " Why, I believe that gif Kilgour did mell with the affair atall, he was moved to adventure it by love of you.

title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: "Well, well," said Maitland, "so much the better sor you,lass, gif Kilgour is, as ye think, the guilty man.

title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: " Oh, Kilgour, Kilgour !" said he, " I had fancied ye a betterman.

title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: " Oh, Kilgour, Kilgour !" said he, " I had fancied ye a betterman.

title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: "Ah, Kilgour," said he, coming up to the bedside and gripping my hand, "How goes it with you?

title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: " Ay, Kilgour," chuckled Bonny, pushing me forward, " hemaks a bonnie lass."

title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: " Your lugs, Kilgour," returned my companion, some-dealsour like I thought, and fixing his heid-piece tighter as he spoke,"your lugs, Kilgour, I doubt have gained at the expense ofsomething else, gif they can hear what the wind should carryaway—for it has been at our backs all the way.

title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: " Your lugs, Kilgour," returned my companion, some-dealsour like I thought, and fixing his heid-piece tighter as he spoke,"your lugs, Kilgour, I doubt have gained at the expense ofsomething else, gif they can hear what the wind should carryaway—for it has been at our backs all the way.

title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: " Reason, Kilgour, reason, man," said he, in answer to myquestion.

title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: Now, Kilgour," he whispered, " come awa.

title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: I doubt, Kilgour, the Secretar will be wud when hehears of this.

title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: " Faith ! I would rather ye speired than kicked, Kilgour."

title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: " By the mass, you are in the right, Kilgour, and a close rubit was.

title: Secretar. Founded on the story of the Casket Letters
author: Beatty, W.
snippet: " Hey day, Kilgour ! " said he, " ye are still the same boldlad, I see ; how does the Golden Sun and the fair MistressAinslie—"
